name: misjudgment
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an unfair or wrong opinion about someone or something: Their decision to sell the house was a disastrous misjudgment. He is accused of making serious misjudgments and arriving at key decisions without adequate consultation.
a wrong guess about an amount or distance: I made a serious misjudgment of the ages of the children. I did not realise how young some of them were. We wound round narrow mountain roads, fearing a minor misjudgment would send us crashing down a sheer drop. See
misjudge
More examplesFewer examplesThey might have done wrong or made colossal misjudgments.They made a serious misjudgment by assuming that the pound would fall steadily over time.One slight misjudgment would have meant death.
